sen.j: 忍び物見（しのびものみ）は、戦国時代 (日本)、戦場で、山野に隠れて敵情をさぐる斥候。
sen.e: Shinomi-monimi is a way of patrolling where a person hides in a wood and searches the enemy's situation in the battle field in the Sengoku period.
Shinobi-monomi is a way of patrolling during the Sengoku period where a person hides in fields and mountains and searches for the enemy's situation in the battle field.
sen.cmt: 文頭（しのびものみ）の表記を修正致しました。

sen.j: だれにも見つからないように山野に伏し、草むらにかくれ、敵地の形勢、敵兵の動静などを視察する。
sen.e: When doing shinobi-monomi, a person conceals himself in a wood without anyone knowing it, hides behind a bush and search the state of the enemy territory and movement of the enemy.

sen.j: ふつうの物見（のちの将校斥候くらいに相当する）よりは地位は低く、徒卒、足軽などがあてられた。
sen.e: Shinobi-monomi was positioned lower than usual monomi (which is equal to shoko-sekko (officer patrol)) and tosotsu (foot soldier) and ashigaru (common foot soldier) were assigned to this task.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shinobi-monomi was classified lower than the usual monomi (which is equal to the later shoko-sekko (officer patrol)) and tosotsu (foot soldier) and ashigaru (common foot soldier) were assigned to perform this task.
sen.cmt: より自然な表現となるように修正致しました。

sen.e: In the article of July 26, 1582 of the 'Matsudaira Ietada Nikki' (a diary of Ietada MATSUDAIRA), Ieyasu TOKUGAWA used a kamari when he fought against Yoritada SUWA of Shinano Province.

sen.e: A description can be seen in the article of July 26, 1582 of the 'Matsudaira Ietada Nikki' (a diary of Ietada MATSUDAIRA), about Ieyasu TOKUGAWA using a kamari when he was fighting Yoritada SUWA of Shinano Province.

sen.j: 「大須賀記」天正10年8月27日には、徳川家康が北条氏直と甲斐国新府でたたかったときに横須賀衆の手でかまりの指図をさせたことがみえる。
sen.e: In the 'Osukaki,' on August 27, 1582, when Ieyasu TOKUGAWA fought against Ujinao HOJO at the Shinpu-jo Castle in the Kai Province, he ordered a group of vassals in Yokosuka to do kamari.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: An article dated September 13, 1582 in 'Osukaki,' describes Ieyasu TOKUGAWA commanding a group of vassals in Yokosuka to perform kamari when he was fighting Ujinao HOJO at the Shinpu-jo Castle in the Kai Province.
sen.cmt: 8月27日という日付についてですが、おそらく旧暦かと考え修正致しました。
sen.e: An article dated September 23, 1582 in 'Osukaki,' describes Ieyasu TOKUGAWA commanding a group of vassals in Yokosuka to perform kamari when he was fighting Ujinao HOJO at the Shinpu-jo Castle in the Kai Province.
